description: Length of Roman notation for n <= length of decimal representation.
comments: The Roman numeration system used here is the naive one taught in primary school. This sequence, like many others involving numeration systems, is neither well-defined nor interesting for large values of n. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 03 2008
links: Nathaniel Johnston, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..199 (complete up to 3999)
example: 15 = XV has length 2 in both notations.
maple: for n from 1 to 3999 do if(length(convert(n, roman)) <= length(n))then printf("%d, ", n): fi: od: # Nathaniel Johnston, May 18 2011
prog: (Haskell)a036788 n = a036788_list !! (n-1)a036788_list = [x | x <- [1..], a006968 x <= a055642 x]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 20 2013
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: Corrected and extended by Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), Sep 25 2000
